Wisdom: اجْعَلْ لِنَفْسِكَ فِيمَا بَيْنَكَ وَبَيْنَ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ أَفْضَلَ الْمَوَاقِيتِ وَالْأَقْسَامِ
enWisdom: Reserve for yourself the best times and portions for that which is between you and Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: إِنَّ قَوْماً عَبَدُوا اللَّهَ سُبْحَانَهُ رَغْبَةً فَتِلْكَ عِبَادَةُ التُّجَّارِ وَقَوْماً عَبَدُوهُ رَهْبَةً فَتِلْكَ عِبَادَةُ الْعَبِيدِ وَقَوْماً عَبَدُوهُ شُكْراً فَتِلْكَ عِبَادَةُ الْأَحْرَارِ
enWisdom: Verily a group worshipped Allah, the Glorified, out of desire [for reward] that is the worship of the traders, and a group worshipped Him out of fear [of punishment] that is the worship of the slaves, and a group worshipped Him out of gratitude and that is the worship of the freemen

Wisdom: إِذَا أَحَبَّ اللَّهُ عَبْداً أَلْهَمَهُ حُسْنَ الْعِبَادَةِ
enWisdom: When Allah loves a servant, he inspires him with the goodness of worship
Continued worship is proof of success in attainment of prosperity
The excellence of the eminent ones is in [their] devout worship [of Allah]

Wisdom: كَيْفَ يَجِدُ لَذَّةَ الْعِبَادَةِ مَنْ لَا يَصُومُ عَنِ الْهَوَى
enWisdom: How can one who does not abstain from lowly desires discover the delight of worship?
Whoever does business with Allah, profits

Wisdom: مَنْ قَامَ بِشَرَائِطِ الْعُبُودِيَّةِ أُهِّلَ لِلْعِتْقِ
enWisdom: One who fulfils the conditions of servitude deserves to be freed

Wisdom: مِنَ الْمَوَدَّةِ الْعَمَلُ لِلَّهِ فَوْقَ الطَّاقَةِ
enWisdom: Part of magnanimity is going beyond one’s [normal] capacity in working for [the pleasure of] Allah

Wisdom: مَا تَقَرَّبَ مُتَقَرِّبٌ بِمِثْلِ عِبَادَةِ اللَّهِ
enWisdom: One who seeks nearness [to Allah] is not brought closer [to Him] by anything other than the worship of Allah

Wisdom: خَادِعْ نَفْسَكَ عَنِ الْعِبَادَةِ وَارْفُقْ بِهَا وَخُذْ عَفْوَهَا وَنِشَاطَهَا إِلَّا مَا كَانَ مَكْتُوباً مِنَ الْفَرِيضَةِ فَإِنَّهُ لَا بُدَّ مِنْ أَدَائِهَا
enWisdom: Deceive your heart into worshipping and be gentle with it (or do not compel it), and engage it [in worship] when it is free and lively, except for what has been prescribed as obligatory, for indeed that must be fulfilled [in any case]
A person may be a devotee while he [actually] has no religion

Wisdom: الْعِبَادَةُ الْخَالِصَةُ أَنْ لَا يَرْجُوَ الرَّجُلُ إِلَّا رَبَّهُ وَلَا يَخَافَ إِلَّا ذَنْبَهُ
enWisdom: Sincere worship means that a person [puts his] hopes in none other than his Lord and fears nothing but his wrongdoing
The best worship is safeguarding the stomach and private parts [from the forbidden]
The best worship is overcoming [a bad] habit
The adornment of worship is humility [and submissiveness]
